title: Cross-Chain with Merkle Bridge
description: Explore Merkle, a cross-chain bridge protocol that enables secure asset transfers between Aptos and other major blockchains through a unique bridging architecture focused on security and efficiency.

tasks.title: Prepare for Cross-Chain Activities
tasks.description: Add at least 0.1 APT to your wallet to explore Merkle's bridging capabilities

tasks.title: Merkle Basics
tasks.description: Understand what Merkle is and what it offers
tasks.question: What is Merkle's primary function?
options: A cross-chain bridge for transferring assets between blockchains
tasks.correctAnswer: A cross-chain bridge for transferring assets between blockchains

tasks.title: Bridging Architecture
tasks.question: What type of bridging architecture does Merkle use?
options: Centralized bridging with a single validator
Lock and mint mechanism with secure verification
tasks.correctAnswer: Lock and mint mechanism with secure verification

tasks.title: Supported Chains
tasks.question: Which blockchains can typically be bridged to Aptos via Merkle?
options: Multiple chains including Ethereum, Solana, BNB Chain, and more
tasks.correctAnswer: Multiple chains including Ethereum, Solana, BNB Chain, and more

tasks.title: Token Types
tasks.description: Learn about the assets that can be bridged
tasks.question: What types of tokens can typically be bridged with Merkle?
options: Only native coins like APT and ETH
Various tokens including native coins, stablecoins, and other tokens
tasks.correctAnswer: Various tokens including native coins, stablecoins, and other tokens

tasks.title: Security Model
tasks.question: What security features does Merkle implement for its bridge?
options: Multi-signature security, validators, and secure proof verification
Only manual verification by the team
tasks.correctAnswer: Multi-signature security, validators, and secure proof verification

tasks.title: Wrapped Tokens
tasks.description: Learn about token representation across chains
tasks.question: How do bridged tokens appear on the destination chain with Merkle?
options: As wrapped versions denoting they originated from another chain
They can only be viewed, not used
tasks.correctAnswer: As wrapped versions denoting they originated from another chain

tasks.title: Bridging Time
tasks.question: What typically affects the completion time of a Merkle bridge transfer?
options: Only the bridge's internal processing speed
Source and destination chain block confirmation times
tasks.correctAnswer: Source and destination chain block confirmation times

tasks.title: Fee Structure
tasks.description: Learn about the costs of using Merkle
tasks.question: How are fees typically structured for Merkle bridge transfers?
options: Fixed fee regardless of amount or destination
Variable fees based on transfer amount, gas costs, and destination chain
tasks.correctAnswer: Variable fees based on transfer amount, gas costs, and destination chain

tasks.title: Wallet Compatibility
tasks.description: Understanding how to interact with Merkle
tasks.question: What wallets can typically be used with Merkle on Aptos?
options: Multiple wallets including Petra, Martian, and other Aptos-compatible wallets
tasks.correctAnswer: Multiple wallets including Petra, Martian, and other Aptos-compatible wallets

tasks.title: Bridging Use Cases
tasks.description: Learn about reasons to use cross-chain bridges
tasks.question: What is a common use case for Merkle bridge transfers?
options: Moving assets between chains to access different DeFi protocols or applications
tasks.correctAnswer: Moving assets between chains to access different DeFi protocols or applications
